item.title: Inverse spectral problems for positive Hankel operators
item.description: arXiv:2503.22189v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A Hankel operator $\Gamma$ in $L^2(\mathbb{R}_+)$ is an integral operator with the integral kernel of the form $h(t+s)$, where $h$ is known as the kernel function. It is known that $\Gamma$ is positive semi-definite if and only if $h$ is the Laplace transform of a positive measure $\mu$ on $\mathbb{R}_+$. Thus, positive semi-definite Hankel operators $\Gamma$ are parameterised by measures $\mu$ on $\mathbb{R}_+$. We consider the class of $\Gamma$ corresponding to \emph{finite} measures $\mu$. In this case it is possible to define the (scalar) spectral measure $\sigma$ of $\Gamma$ in a natural way. The measure $\sigma$ is also finite on $\mathbb{R}_+$. This defines the \emph{spectral map} $\mu\mapsto\sigma$ on finite measures on $\mathbb{R}_+$. We prove that this map is an involution; in particular, it is a bijection. We also consider a dual variant of this problem for measures $\mu$ that are not necessarily finite but have the finite integral \[ \int_0^\infty x^{-2}\mathrm{d}\mu(x); \] we call such measures \emph{co-finite}.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Pushnitski, Sergei Treil

item.title: Quasi-unitary equivalence and generalised norm resolvent convergence
item.description: arXiv:2503.22611v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The purpose of this article is to give a short introduction to the concept of quasi-unitary equivalence of quadratic forms and its consequences. In particular, we improve an estimate concerning the transitivity of quasi-unitary equivalence for forms. We illustrate the abstract setting by two classes of examples.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Rev. Roumaine Math. Pures Appl. 64 (2019), no. 2-3, 373-391, https://zbmath.org/1438.47028
item.dc:creator: Olaf Post, Jan Simmer

item.title: Spherical caps do not always maximize Neumann eigenvalues on the sphere
item.description: arXiv:2503.15385v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove the existence of an open set $\Omega\subset\mathbb{S}^2$ for which the first positive eigenvalue of the Laplacian with Neumann boundary condition exceeds that of the geodesic disk having the same area. This example holds for large areas and contrasts with results by Bandle and later authors proving maximality of the disk under additional topological or geometric conditions, thereby revealing such conditions to be necessary.
item.dc:creator: Dorin Bucur, Richard S. Laugesen, Eloi Martinet, Micka\"el Nahon

item.title: Convexity on Manifolds without Focal points and Spectrum of the Laplacian
item.description: arXiv:2503.22185v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Convexity on complete Riemannian manifolds has typically been studied under constraints on the sign of sectional curvatures. This is especially so in the study of the effect of convexity on the spectrum of the Laplacian. In this article, we use the language of Jacobi tensors to construct a strictly convex function with bounded gradient on complete simply connected manifolds without focal points having negative Ricci curvature. From this we obtain a lower bound for the growth of the volume of geodesic balls, if the manifold is also assumed to be K\"ahler. Our primary applications concern the spectrum of the Laplacian. We use the strictly convex function which we construct to show that the spectrum of the Laplacian is absolutely continuous on a class of asymptotically harmonic manifolds. In fact, we completely determine the spectrum of the Laplacian on simply connected noncompact nonflat harmonic manifolds without focal points. For asymptotically harmonic manifolds we also show that equality holds in Cheeger's inequality for the bottom of the spectrum, where Cheeger's constant is equal to the constant mean curvature of the horospheres. We show that the well known description of the spectrum of the Laplacian on Riemannian symmetric spaces of noncompact type and arbitrary rank can also be recovered using these geometric methods.
item.dc:creator: Aprameyan Parthasarathy (Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India), B Sivashankar (Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India)

item.title: An isoperimetric inequality for lower order Neumann eigenvalues in Gauss space
item.description: arXiv:2503.15813v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove a sharp isoperimetric inequality for the harmonic mean of the first $m-1$ nonzero Neumann eigenvalues for bounded Lipschitz domains symmetric about the origin in Gauss space. Our result generalizes the Szeg\"o-Weinberger type inequality in Gauss space, as proved in [8, Theorem 4.1].
item.dc:creator: Yi Gao, Kui Wang

item.title: Equivalence between non-commutative harmonic oscillators and two-photon quantum Rabi models
item.description: arXiv:2405.19814v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that the non-commutative harmonic oscillator on $L^2(\mathbb{R})\otimes\mathbb{C}^2$ introduced by Parmeggiani and Wakayama is equivalent to the two-photon quantum Rabi model, and they are also equivalent to a holomorphic differential equation on the unit disk. The confluence process of this differential equation and the relation with the one-photon quantum Rabi model are also discussed.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Int. Math. Res. Not. IMRN 2025, no. 7, rnaf066
item.dc:creator: Ryosuke Nakahama

item.title: $H^2$-regularity of Steklov eigenfunctions on convex domains via Rellich-Pohozaev identity
item.description: arXiv:2503.19852v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that the Steklov eigenfunctions on convex domains of $\mathbb R^n$ are $H^2$ regular by adapting a classical argument combined with the Rellich-Pohozaev identity.
item.dc:creator: Pier Domenico Lamberti, Luigi Provenzano
